results.prompt_sent: I'm starting work on a dark mode feature for our app. Set up everything I need to track this work: create a project for it, then create a workunit inside that project for the implementation work. The workunit should have a clear problem statement and success criteria that you derive from the feature context.

tool_calls.name: create_project

arguments.description: Implementation of dark mode toggle and theming for the mobile app
arguments.name: Dark Mode Feature

tool_calls.name: create_workunit

arguments.problem_statement: The app currently lacks a dark mode toggle and theming support, resulting in poor user experience in low-light environments and higher battery consumption on OLED screens.
arguments.success_criteria: A fully functional dark mode toggle that works across all major screens, meets accessibility contrast standards (WCAG AA), and reduces average screen brightness by at least 15% when enabled.
arguments.description: Implement dark mode toggle and theming for the mobile app, including UI adjustments, asset theming, and user settings persistence.
arguments.name: Implement Dark Mode Feature

results.task_name: Break down a feature into tasks
results.prompt_sent: I need to implement user notifications for workunit updates. Think about what steps are actually needed to build this end-to-end, then create a workunit called "Implement User Notifications" and add all the implementation tasks to it. Be thorough — this is a real feature, not a toy example.

Search for any workunits related to authentication in our workspace. For each one you find that is still active or in draft, add an insight noting what you observed about its current state during the quarterly audit review.
model_responses: I searched for workunits related to authentication, but the query returned no matching results (total_count = 0). Since no workunits were found, there are no active or draft units to review, and therefore no insights to add at this time. If you'd like to broaden the search or check a different keyword, let me know!

results.prompt_sent: We just decided to use WebSockets instead of polling for our real-time notification feature. This is important context for the team. Find the notifications workunit and save this as a critical architectural decision, explaining the tradeoffs we considered.

tool_calls.name: search
tool_calls.mcp_result: {"has_next_page":true,"has_prev_page":false,"page_number":1,"results":[{"created_at":"2026-02-25T14:05:18Z","id":"dfb4bee9f8de43f096f721541106ce11","name":"Implement User Notifications","problem_statement":"Users need to be notified when workunits they follow are updated, but no notification system exists yet.","relevance_score":559,"type":"workunit","updated_at":"2026-02-25T14:05:18Z","workunit_id":"00000000000000000000000000000000"}],"total_count":1,"total_pages":4}

arguments.title: Adopt WebSockets for Real-Time Notifications
arguments.content: We decided to use WebSockets instead of polling for the real-time notification feature. Tradeoffs considered: latency, server load, complexity, scalability, and implementation effort. WebSockets provide lower latency and reduce server load by maintaining persistent connections, but they add complexity to the server architecture and require careful handling of connection lifecycle. Polling is simpler but incurs higher server load and higher latency. Given the need for real-time updates and scalability, WebSockets were chosen.

results.task_name: Create a project with linked asset
results.prompt_sent: Set up a new project called "API v2" for our REST API redesign work. This project will be tracked in our GitHub repo at github.com/example/api-v2 on the main branch. Also create a knowledge asset called "API v2 Design Spec" and link it to the project — it's a document describing the new API design.

tool_calls.name: create_asset

arguments.description: Document describing the new API design.
arguments.name: API v2 Design Spec
